title: Question 25
prompt: A state lottery draws 6 lottery numbers from 1 through 50. After a number is drawn, it is taken out of the pool, so that it cannot be drawn twice. Margery always puts her age, 34, on her lottery ticket. This week, the number 5 is drawn on the first draw, and removed from the pool. On the second draw, what are the odds of drawing the number 34?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: The odds of drawing any particular number on the second draw are 1 in 49. When the first number is drawn, it is removed from the pool. When the number 5 is taken away, there are 49 numbers remaining: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and all the numbers up to 50. So, there are 49 possible outcomes of the draw. There is one positive outcome, the number 34. The odds of drawing the number 34 are 1 in 49, one positive outcome out of 49 possible outcomes.
